assignUser commented on PR #12893:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12893#issuecomment-1102806617

   The `linux-headers` thing was a red hering the actual issue was: `Can't locate IPC/Cmd.pm in @INC (@INC contains:` 
   Which seems to be fixed by installing `perl-IPC-Cmd` via yum. 
   I'll push once the build finishes on my machine. 
   
   @kszucs I don't really know why the macos build would fail due to permission issues (e.g. https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/runs/6077317725?check_suite_focus=true#step:8:27 ) do you have any insights on what could cause that?

kszucs commented on PR #12893:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12893#issuecomment-1103807084

   
   > @kszucs I don't really know why the macos build would fail due to permission issues (e.g. https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/runs/6077317725?check_suite_focus=true#step:8:27 ) do you have any insights on what could cause that?
   
   The github actions service has stopped on our self-hosted machine and when I applied a workaround I started it with the wrong user. It should be fixed now.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
While testing out the windows docker images I cam across this issue: [https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/issues/2518]

This probably has not affected nightlies because of cached builds (?)

Some of the port patches (addressing arm compatibility) are no longer needed either.
